intro: Colobanthus brevisepalus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pearlwort, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in coastal environments.
